data.name: Input
data.description: Existing Samples in DataHub that represent input for this protocol.

data.name: library construction
data.description: type of assay or experimental step performed.

data.name: library_construction_protocol
data.description: Free form text describing the protocol by which the sequencing library was constructed.

data.name: Title
data.description: Short text that can be used to call out experiment records in searches or in displays.

data.name: design_description
data.description: The design of the library including details of how it was constructed.

data.name: library source
data.description: The LIBRARY_SOURCE specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced. (SRA 1.2 documentation)

data.name: library strategy
data.description: Sequencing technique intended for this library (SRA 1.2 documentation)

data.name: library selection
data.description: Whether any method was used to select for or against, enrich, or screen the material being sequenced. (SRA 1.2 documentation)

data.name: library layout
data.description: specifies whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads. In the case of paired reads, information about the relative distance and orientation is specified.

data.name: insert size
data.description: Insert size for paired reads.

data.name: library name
data.description: Name given to the generated library

data.name: submission date
data.description: Date in which experiment was submitted to ENA.

data.name: status
data.description: Status of submission to ENA.

data.name: accession
data.description: ENA experiment accession code. Provided by ENA after submission.

data.name: Input
data.description: Existing Samples in DataHub that represent input for this protocol.

data.name: nucleic acid extraction
data.description: type of assay or experimental step performed.

data.name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
data.description: Volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

data.name: Extract Name
data.description: User-defined names for each portion of extracted material.

data.name: Input
data.description: Existing Samples in DataHub that represent input for this protocol.

data.name: nucleic acid sequencing
data.description: type of assay or experimental step performed.

data.name: sequencing instrument
data.description: a parameter to report the sequencing instrument model and make

data.name: file type
data.description: The run data file model.

data.name: file checksum
data.description: The MD5 checksum of the file.

data.name: Raw Data File
data.description: Name (or URI) of the raw data file generated by an assay.

data.name: submission date
data.description: Date in which run was submitted to ENA.Date of submission to ENA.

data.name: status
data.description: Status of submission to ENA.

data.name: accession
data.description: ENA run accession code. Provided by ENA after submission.

data.name: Input
data.description: Existing Samples in DataHub that represent input for this protocol.

data.name: sample collection
data.description: type of assay or experimental step performed.

data.name: sample collection device or method
data.description: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

data.name: sample material processing
data.description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. This field accepts OBI, for a browser of OBI (v 2013-10-25) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI

data.name: amount or size of sample collected
data.description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

data.name: sample storage duration
data.description: duration for which sample was stored

data.name: sample storage temperature
data.description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

data.name: sample storage location
data.description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

data.name: Sample Name
data.description: Samples represent major outputs resulting from a protocol application other than the special case outputs of Extract or a Labeled Extract.

data.name: Input
data.description: Existing Samples in DataHub that represent input for this protocol.

data.name: sample collection
data.description: type of assay or experimental step performed.

data.name: Sample Name
data.description: Name of the major output resulting from the application of the protocol.

data.name: Input
data.description: Existing Samples in DataHub that represent input for this protocol.

data.name: sequence assembly
data.description: type of assay or experimental step performed.

data.name: Normalization Name
data.description: User-defined name for each normalization applied

data.name: Data Transformation Name
data.description: a data transformation

data.name: Derived Data File
data.description: derived data such as an assembly file

data.name: Source Name
data.description: Sources are considered as the starting biological material used in a study.

data.name: Title
data.description: Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

data.name: Description
data.description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

data.name: tax_id
data.description: NCBI Taxonomy Identifier number ID. This is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

data.name: organism
data.description: Provide a taxonomic information associated to the Source Biological material (for example, Species, genus, strain,....). Ideally, provide NCBI TaxID or NEWT identifier

data.name: cell_type
data.description: cell type from which the sample was obtained

data.name: dev_stage
data.description: if the sample was obtained from an organism in a specific developmental stage, it is specified with this qualifier

data.name: germline
data.description: the sample described presented in the entry has not undergone somatic genomic rearrangement as part of an adaptive immune response; it is the unrearranged molecule that was inherited from the parental germline

data.name: tissue_lib
data.description: tissue library from which sample was obtained

data.name: tissue_type
data.description: tissue type from which the sample was obtained

data.name: collection_date
data.description: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

data.name: isolation_source
data.description: describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived

data.name: lat_lon
data.description: geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected

data.name: collected_by
data.description: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

data.name: geographic location (country and/or sea)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
CVList: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

data.name: geographic location (region and locality)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

data.name: identified_by
data.description: name of the expert who identified the specimen taxonomically

data.name: environmental_sample
data.description: identifies sequences derived by direct molecular isolation from a bulk environmental DNA sample (by PCR with or without subsequent cloning of the product, DGGE, or other anonymous methods) with no reliable identification of the source organism

data.name: mating_type
data.description: mating type of the organism from which the sequence was obtained; mating type is used for prokaryotes, and for eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes

data.name: sex
data.description: sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

data.name: lab_host
data.description: scientific name of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism from which the sample was obtained

data.name: host scientific name
data.description: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

data.name: bio_material
data.description: identifier for the biological material from which the sample was obtained, with optional institution code and collection code for the place where it is currently stored.

data.name: culture_collection
data.description: institution code and identifier for the culture from which the sample was obtained, with optional collection code.

data.name: specimen_voucher
data.description: identifier for the specimen from which the sample was obtained

data.name: cultivar
data.description: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sample was obtained

data.name: ecotype
data.description: a population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

data.name: isolate
data.description: individual isolate from which the sample was obtained

data.name: sub_species
data.description: name of sub-species of organism from which sample was obtained

data.name: variety
data.description: variety (= varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sample was derived.

data.name: sub_strain
data.description: name or identifier of a genetically or otherwise modified strain from which sample was obtained, derived from a parental strain (which should be annotated in the strain field; sub_strain from which sample was obtained

data.name: cell_line
data.description: cell line from which the sample was obtained

data.name: serotype
data.description: serological variety of a species characterized by its antigenic properties

data.name: serovar
data.description: serological variety of a species (usually a prokaryote) characterized by its antigenic properties

data.name: strain
data.description: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

data.name: submission date
data.description: Date in which sample was submitted to ENA.

data.name: status
data.description: Status of submission to ENA.

data.name: accession
data.description: ENA sample accession code. Provided by ENA after submission.

data.name: Source Name
data.description: Sources are considered as the starting biological material used in a study.

data.name: Title
data.description: Short text that can be used to call out sample records in search results or in displays.

data.name: Description
data.description: Free-form text describing the sample, its origin, and its method of isolation.

data.name: tax_id
data.description: NCBI Taxonomy Identifier number ID. This is appropriate for individual organisms and some environmental samples.

data.name: organism
data.description: Scientific name of sample that distinguishes its taxonomy.  Please use a name or synonym that is tracked in the INSDC Taxonomy database. Also, this field can be used to confirm the TAXON_ID setting.

data.name: ploidy
data.description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2013-10-28) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

data.name: number of replicons
data.description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

data.name: extrachromosomal elements
data.description: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

data.name: estimated size
data.description: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

data.name: collected_by
data.description: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

data.name: collection date
data.description: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

data.name: geographic location (altitude)
data.description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

data.name: geographic location (country and/or sea)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
CVList: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

data.name: geographic location (latitude)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

data.name: geographic location (longitude)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

data.name: geographic location (region and locality)
data.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

data.name: identified_by
data.description: name of the expert who identified the specimen taxonomically

data.name: geographic location (depth)
data.description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

data.name: environment (biome)
data.description: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland, or coral reef. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

data.name: environment (feature)
data.description: Environmental feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

data.name: geographic location (elevation)
data.description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

data.name: source material identifiers
data.description: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

data.name: isolation and growth condition
data.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

data.name: propagation
data.description: This field is specific to different taxa. For plants: sexual/asexual, for phages: lytic/lysogenic, for plasmids: incompatibility group (Note: there is the strong opinion to name phage propagation obligately lytic or temperate, therefore we also give this choice. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, plasmids and viruses.

data.name: plant structure
data.description: name of plant structure that the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) terms see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051); if an individual flower is sampled the sex of it can be recorded here

data.name: plant developmental stage
data.description: developmental stage at the time of sample collection; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. hypocotyl emergence stage (PO_0007043)

data.name: sampled age
data.description: age of subject at the time of sample collection; relevant scale depends on species and study; e.g. 2 weeks old

data.name: sample phenotype
data.description: phenotype of the plant from which the sample was obtained, such as colour of corolla, fruit diameter, circular leaf shape; Plant Trait Ontology (TO), Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), or other ontology is recommended; e.g. stem epidermis colour (TO:1000018)

data.name: sample health state
data.description: health status of the subject at the time of sample collection

data.name: sample disease status
data.description: list of diseases with which the subject has been diagnosed at the time of sample collection; can include multiple diagnoses; the value of the field depends on subject; e.g. Charcoal rot (Macrophomina phaseolina), Late wilt (Cephalosporium maydis)

data.name: sample disease stage
data.description: stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen

data.name: sample wet mass
data.description: measurement of wet mass at the time of sample collection; e.g. 0.23 g

data.name: sample dry mass
data.description: measurement of dry mass at the time of sample collection; e.g. 0.05g

data.name: sample height
data.description: height of subject at the time of sampling, if different from the length; e.g. 0.75m

data.name: sample length
data.description: length of subject at the time of sampling, if different from the height; e.g. 2m

data.name: growth facility
data.description: type of facility where the sampled plant was grown

data.name: sample capture status
data.description: Reason for the sample collection.
CVList: active surveillance in response to outbreak
active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak

data.name: genotype
data.description: name or code for genotype of organism

data.name: genetic modification
data.description: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

data.name: organism common name
data.description: common name of the subject organism, e.g. maize

data.name: subspecific genetic lineage rank
data.description: further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e. variety, cultivar, ecotype, inbred line,; it can also contain alternative taxonomic information

data.name: subspecific genetic lineage name
data.description: name of the infraspecific rank, e.g ecotype Col-0

data.name: biological status
data.description: the level of genome modification; controlled vocabulary: wild, natural, semi-natural, inbred line, breeder's line, hybrid, clonal selection, mutant

data.name: organism phenotype
data.description: most relevant phenotypic traits of the subject; for Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO, e.g. bifurcated (PATO_0001784); terms from Trait Ontology (TO), Plant Ontology (PO) or Crop Ontology (CO) are also accepted; include name/method/scale for each trait; can include multiple traits

data.name: ancestral data
data.description: information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

data.name: source material description
data.description: further information to clarify the nature of the specimen or population used that is not collected elsewhere, e.g. if source was derived from accessioned stock, describe how it links to the original material

data.name: biotic relationship
data.description: free text description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associate with, e.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y, the target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object

data.name: growth habit
data.description: characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species

data.name: plant sex
data.description: sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistilate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite

data.name: climate environment
data.description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

data.name: gaseous environment
data.description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

data.name: seasonal environment
data.description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

data.name: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
data.description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

data.name: soil_taxonomic/local classification
data.description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

data.name: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
data.description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

data.name: soil type
data.description: soil series name or other lower-level classification

data.name: soil type method
data.description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

data.name: drainage classification
data.description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

data.name: texture
data.description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

data.name: texture method
data.description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

data.name: soil water content
data.description: water content measurement; e.g. 13.6%

data.name: soil pH
data.description: pH measurement of the soil; e.g. 6.2

data.name: plant growth medium
data.description: specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium, recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium or other controlled vocabulary

data.name: rooting conditions
data.description: relevant rooting conditions, such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container

data.name: culture rooting medium
data.description: name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium, can be a name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium; e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium, if the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors

data.name: rooting medium macronutrients
data.description: measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

data.name: rooting medium micronutrients
data.description: measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2mg/L)

data.name: rooting medium organic supplements
data.description: organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitaimins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. Nicotinic acid (0.5mg/L)

data.name: rooting medium carbon
data.description: source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose

data.name: rooting medium regulators
data.description: growth regulators in the culture rooting medium, such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5mg/L NAA

data.name: rooting medium solidifier
data.description: specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar

data.name: rooting medium pH
data.description: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5

data.name: air temperature regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

data.name: antibiotic regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

data.name: chemical mutagen
data.description: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

data.name: fertilizer regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

data.name: fungicide regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

data.name: gravity
data.description: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

data.name: growth hormone regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

data.name: herbicide regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

data.name: humidity regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

data.name: mineral nutrient regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

data.name: non-mineral nutrient regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

data.name: pesticide regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

data.name: pH regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

data.name: radiation regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

data.name: rainfall regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

data.name: salt regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

data.name: standing water regimen
data.description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

data.name: watering regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

data.name: water temperature regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

data.name: plant treatment
data.description: ontology term(s) that describes the plant treatment or relevant environmental conditions, recommend use of Plant Environment Ontology (EO) or other ontology, such as XEML Environment Ontology (XEO) or Crop Ontology (CO), more specific fields in the treatment section can be used in addition to or in place of this field

data.name: light regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving an exposure to light, this includes both light intensity and quality

data.name: biotic regimen
data.description: information about treatment involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi

data.name: mechanical damage
data.description: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

data.name: chemical administration
data.description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

data.name: perturbation
data.description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

data.name: submission date
data.description: Date in which sample was submitted to ENA.

data.name: status
data.description: Status of submission to ENA.

data.name: accession
data.description: ENA sample accession code. Provided by ENA after submission.
